subject: Re: [junit] Re: Using real data or test data?
msgSnippet: ... This probably has to do with the tendency for real data to require interconnexions between objects, whereas we can create fake data that doesn t. I think
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

> I consider testing with real data to be an integration test while
> testing with invented data would be more of a unit test.

This probably has to do with the tendency for real data to require
interconnexions between objects, whereas we can create fake data that
doesn't. I think the two are related, but it's certainly both possible
and wise to use some real data (even if you abbreviate it for testing)
at all levels of testing.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
